title: Week 12 Anger Index: Why a No. 15 ranking isn't good enough for Miami
content: After jumping up three spots, Miami still has plenty to be upset about, but what other teams should be mad?

title: Ohio St., IU, Texas A&M, Alabama top CFP ranking
content: The top five teams remained unchanged in the second set of rankings released by the College Football Playoff selection committee on Tuesday, with Ohio State at No. 1, followed by fellow unbeatens Indiana and Texas A&M, and one-loss Alabama and Georgia.

title: Source: CB Alexander stepping away from football
content: Former Pro Bowl cornerback Jaire Alexander has decided to step away from football in order to focus on getting right physically and mentally amid his ongoing recovery from offseason knee surgery, a league source confirmed to ESPN on Tuesday.

title: Vogt (AL), Murphy (NL) repeat as Managers of Year
content: Cleveland's Stephen Vogt won his second straight AL Manager of the Year award and Milwaukee's Pat Murphy repeated for the NL honor.

title: GM: Respect calls, but Pirates not trading Skenes
content: Pirates GM Ben Cherington said he has regularly received inquiries from clubs regarding Paul Skenes' availability but reiterated that the team will not trade the ace right-hander this offseason.

title: Mavs fire GM Harrison amid continued fan angst
content: The Mavericks on Tuesday fired general manager Nico Harrison, who had been under fire from fans following last season's trade of Luka Doncic to the Lakers.

title: Jags' Hunter has surgery, out for rest of season
content: Jaguars rookie wide receiver/cornerback Travis Hunter will miss the remainder of the season after undergoing surgery Tuesday to repair the LCL in his right knee.

title: Source: Free agent CB Samuel to join Steelers
content: Free agent cornerback Asante Samuel Jr. is signing with the Steelers on the practice squad, a source told ESPN's Jeremy Fowler on Tuesday.

title: Cards, Arenado on 'same page' for potential trade
content: Cardinals president of baseball operations Chaim Bloom indicated the team is ready to move on from third baseman Nolan Arenado and also is exploring trades for pitcher Sonny Gray.

title: üí∞ Inside the Lakers' unbelievable $241M week
content: The Lakers' fifth-year guard now sits at the center of two major NBA storylines: Helping the team win enough to convince LeBron James to stay in L.A., but playing so well that it might cost the franchise nearly $250M dollars to keep him.

content: From stars with millions in off-court endorsements to those making the minimum, every WNBA player stands to gain in the new CBA.

content: The November international break is usually the time Arsenal begin plotting their next big moves. So what are the issues that are being discussed?

content: Ahead of the early signing window, which 10 programs are already ahead with the class of 2026? Let's start with USC.

content: In the newly expanded top-25 class rankings, Missouri is the only program with multiple five-star commitments.

title: Boxing divisional rankings: Vergil Ortiz Jr. knocks Erickson Lubin out of top 10
content: Vergil Ortiz Jr. needed less than two rounds to retain the WBC interim junior middleweight title. Here are the latest ESPN rankings in all weight classes.

title: John Cena completes the career Grand Slam
content: John Cena beat Dominik Mysterio in an Intercontinental title match, but could these two face off again? Arda Ocal highlights the best moments from "Raw."

title: Heisman Trophy race: Who can still challenge Indiana's Fernando Mendoza?
content: As the odds shift for the Heisman Trophy race, Pamela Maldonado explains how to bet it heading into Week 12.

title: Pune offers to host RCB home ties in Gahunje
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) may end up playing all their home matches in Pune in IPL-2026, it has been learnt. The shift is a direct fallout of the Chinnaswamy Stadium‚Äôs ongoing suspension following the June 4 stampede during RCB‚Äôs victory parade.

title: Vibe coding: Meta‚Äôs AI chief has advice for teens: Says they should spend time on..
content: Meta's Chief AI Officer, Alexandr Wang, urges teenagers to master AI tools, comparing the current era to the dawn of personal computing. He advises dedicating thousands of hours to 'vibe-coding'‚Äîhands-on experimentation with AI‚Äîto gain a significant advantage in the future economy. This approach emphasizes rapid learning through prompting and refining AI outputs.

title: HR sent termination notice by mistake: 300 employees panicked; career lessons from chaos
content: An HR team's accidental test of an offboarding tool sent an email to all 300 employees stating their employment was terminated immediately. Chaos ensued as employees questioned the message, but IT quickly clarified it was a glitch. The incident highlighted the importance of automation oversight and the power of humor in crisis.

title: Chinese Cryptoqueen caught: UK police seize Bitcoin; scam worth billion exposed
content: A Chinese woman has received an 11-year sentence in the UK for laundering millions embezzled from pensioners. Qian Zhimin, who fled China, used a fake passport to enter the UK and lived lavishly. Police seized one of the world's largest crypto hauls, with the Bitcoin's value soaring significantly since its discovery.

title: Flop show continues! Babar Azam adds another unwanted record to his name
content: Babar Azam's last century came against Nepal during the Asia Cup 2023, and he has now equaled Virat Kohli‚Äôs record for the most consecutive international innings without a hundred.

title: Chhattisgarh: 6 Maoists killed in Bijapur encounter; security forces recover arms, ammo
content: Security forces engaged Maoists in Bijapur district. Six rebels were killed. Weapons and explosives were recovered. One Maoist was taken into custody. This operation marks a significant gain for security forces. The Chief Minister praised the personnel. The campaign against Naxalism continues.

title: ‚ÄòDon‚Äôt have notifications‚Äô: JPMorgan chief ignores most texts; keeps phone off at work
content: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon, despite leading a massive bank, limits his phone use at work, turning off notifications and ignoring texts unless from his children. He prioritizes focus in meetings, believing distractions hinder engagement. Dimon also advocates for US schools to evolve, integrating crucial skills like coding and cybersecurity to prepare students for the modern workforce.

title: Michael Duarte cause of death: How did the food influencer FoodWithBearHands die
content: Beloved food creator Michael Duarte, known as FoodWithBearHands, tragically passed away in Texas on November 8, 2025, during a family trip. His sudden death, described as a "horrible incident," has left millions of fans mourning the loss of his cheerful personality and culinary talent. Duarte, a devoted husband and father, inspired many with his generosity and passion for food.

title: Donald Trump slams NFL‚Äôs new kickoff rule, calls it 'demeaning'
content: Donald Trump has voiced strong disapproval of the NFL's new kickoff rule, deeming it "terrible" and "demeaning" to the game's tradition and excitement. Speaking on The Pat McAfee Show, the former President argued that the changes, intended for player safety, have stripped the play of its "power" and "beautiful chaos," sparking renewed debate on preserving football's identity versus prioritizing safety.

title: Yankees Eye $460M Cubs Star to Replace Cody Bellinger in Free Agency
content: The New York Yankees face a pivotal offseason with key players Cody Bellinger and Trent Grisham set to become free agents. If both depart, the team is reportedly a top contender to sign star outfielder Kyle Tucker, who could significantly reshape their roster and offensive core for the 2026 season.

title: ‚ÄòReport GPS spoofing within 10 minutes of occurrence:‚Äô DGCA to pilots, ATC
content: DGCA mandates pilots and air traffic controllers to report GPS spoofing within 10 minutes of detection. This new protocol follows unprecedented GPS anomalies at Delhi Airport, where aircraft have experienced incorrect location data and false terrain warnings. The National Security Advisor's office is investigating the issue, which has been common in conflict zones but is a first for Delhi.

title: US govt shutdown: Dems break rank; is Trump about to get his way?
content: Liberal Democrats are reportedly revolting against party leadership, accusing them of surrendering to President Trump on government reopening without securing healthcare subsidy extensions.  This internal dissent follows a new bill to end the shutdown, supported by centrist Democrats, heading to the House.  Activists and some lawmakers are demanding leadership changes, citing a betrayal of their mandate.

title: 1st Test: From Gill to Bumrah - who did what during first Kolkata practice session?
content: Shubman Gill spent nearly 90 minutes in the nets as he adjusted back to red-ball cricket after recent white-ball games. Before batting, head coach Gautam Gambhir and assistant coach Sitanshu Kotak spoke with him near the High Court end, news agency PTI reported. Among the fast bowlers, only Jasprit Bumrah bowled.

title: Travis Hunter injury update: Recovery timeline and expected return for Jaguars star
content: Jacksonville Jaguars' rookie sensation Travis Hunter is out for the 2025 season after undergoing surgery for a knee injury. The dual-threat star, a second-overall pick, suffered the setback in late October. Doctors confirmed no additional damage, with a six-month recovery expected, putting him on track for training camp next summer.

title: Bihar poll of exit polls: NDA to roar back to power with 148 seats; what pollsters said about MGB
content: Exit polls indicate a strong win for the NDA in the Bihar elections. The alliance is expected to secure a majority of seats. The RJD-led Mahagathbandhan is projected to fall short. High voter turnout was recorded in both phases of the polling. The results will shape the political landscape of Bihar.

title: Retired headmaster detained for controversial post on Delhi blast
content: Police have detained Nazrul Islam Borbhuiya, a retired headmaster from Silchar. He posted a controversial comment on social media following the Delhi blast. The post read 'Election is coming'. Authorities are investigating the intent behind the comment. This incident shows increased scrutiny on social media posts about national events. Police aim to stop provocative narratives.

title: 'Predictable tactic': India says Pak remark aims to deflect internal power grab
content: India has strongly refuted Pakistan's claims linking New Delhi to a suicide bombing near Islamabad, labeling the accusations "baseless and unfounded." The ministry of external affairs stated that Pakistan's allegations are a diversionary tactic to distract from its internal political and constitutional turmoil, a move the international community will not be misled by.

title: Tracking terror: Car parked near Red Fort for 3 hrs; was there another target?
content: A Hyundai i20 exploded near Delhi's Red Fort, killing at least eight and injuring many. Investigators are tracing the car's 11-hour journey from Faridabad, suspecting a terror attack linked to a wider module. A Pulwama doctor is believed to be the lone, masked driver, possibly a fidayeen attacker. The NIA is now leading the probe.

title: Delhi blast: Car was moving, no crater; key reasons agencies think attackers panicked
content: Initial investigations into a car explosion near Delhi's Red Fort suggest it was not a typical suicide attack, but possibly a premature detonation by a panicked suspect. The blast, which killed at least eight people, did not exhibit the usual modus operandi of suicide bombers, with no crater or shrapnel found.

title: Bihar polls: Women voters outshine men; state sees record turnout of 66.9%
content: Bihar witnessed its highest-ever voter turnout, with women significantly outperforming men. Nearly 72% of female electors cast their ballots, compared to 63% of men, driving the overall 66.91% participation. This trend was consistent across both phases of polling, highlighting women's crucial role in this record-breaking election.

title: Rs 23.75cr too high': KKR questioned for Venkatesh Iyer decision
content: Former Australian captain Aaron Finch advises Kolkata Knight Riders to reconsider Venkatesh Iyer's hefty Rs 23.75 crore retention. Finch believes Iyer's current middle-order role, without bowling, doesn't justify the price, despite past match-winning performances. He suggests releasing Iyer to free up funds and potentially reacquiring him at a more balanced cost.

title: Caught in doping! India's Asiad medalist slapped with five-year ban
content: Incheon Asian Games medallist Manju Bala faces a five-year ban for doping violations, testing positive for steroids and SARMS.  Several other athletes, including Mohan Saini, bodybuilders, a boxer, a canoeist, and a basketball player, have also received suspensions ranging from two to six years.  A sprinter's four-year ban was also upheld.

title: Will Smith watches in shock as Sharks‚Äô Macklin Celebrini injured, loses teeth
content: During the game against the Anaheim Ducks, San Jose Sharks rookie Macklin Celebrini hurt his face badly and lost a few teeth. Will Smith, a teammate, saw the whole thing happen and his shocked reaction went viral. Even though it hurt, Celebrini's toughness and quick return to the bench showed how dedicated he was to the game.

title: ‚ÄòPredictable tactic‚Äô: India strongly trashes Pakistan PM's allegations following terror attack in Islamabad
content: External Affairs Ministry spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal said the international community is well aware of the reality and will not be misled by Pakistan's "desperate" ploys

title: How Tamil Nadu witnessed the dramatic arrest and release of Karunanidhi and Stalin in 2001
content: In June 2001, former Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M. Karunanidhi‚Äôs midnight arrest sparked political outrage. Police dragged him from his home and later arrested M.K. Stalin and others in connection with alleged irregularities in the construction of 10 flyovers in Chennai

title: Tamil Nadu among top achievers at Udyog Samagam 2025
content: The Udyog Samagam 2025, held under the aegis of the Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT) in New Delhi, was chaired by Union Minister of Commerce and Industry Piyush Goyal.

title: When a car bomb was dismantled after four tense days in Tamil Nadu
content: Killing at least 13 persons, a high intensity bomb blast in a slow moving car near the Red Fort in New Delhi has rocked the country and a terror angle is being probed. About 27 years ago, 60 kg of gelatin explosives planted in an abandoned car at Coimbatore in Tamil Nadu were removed after four nerve-wracking days and detonated.

title: KIFF centenary tributes: Bengal‚Äôs film fraternity hails Ritwik Ghatak as ‚Äòvoice of Partition, pioneer of alternative cinema‚Äô
content: As part of the centenary tribute, the 31st KIFF organised screenings of six of Ghatak‚Äôs films during the festival between November 6 and November 13, along with an exhibition with his memorabilia at Nandan, the panel discussion today, and the Ritwik Ghatak Memorial Conversation between filmmakers Adoor Gopalakrishnan and Anup Singh, scheduled for November 12

title: ‚ÄòUnacceptable‚Äô: Supreme Court condemns alleged assault of Kerala students in Delhi
content: The top court said that such acts of racial discrimination were wholly ‚Äúunacceptable‚Äù in a country founded on pluralism

title: CBI arrests ‚Äòconman‚Äô and his associate in impersonation and bribery case
content: On November 10, the two accused were caught in Delhi while receiving ‚Çπ18 lakh from one Jagjit Singh Gill, sent by Vinod Parihar, CEO of Cybdeer Network Private Limited

title: Cong. alleges ‚Äòvote chori‚Äô in Kochi Corporation
content: District Congress Committee alleges attempts to add voters using the same house number with different house names and forged rental pacts

title: Rajasthan Chief Secretary Sudhansh Pant shifted to Centre
content: Sudhansh Pant‚Äôs sudden transfer to the Centre, following an approval by the Appointments Committee of the Cabinet (ACC) and coming just 14 months before his retirement, has raised speculations in the political and administrative circles in Jaipur

title: Raju Kage writes to Chief Minister seeking statehood for North Karnataka
content: Taking exception to regional imbalances, MLA of Kagawad Assembly segment and chairman of North Western Karnataka Road Transport Corporation (NWKRTC) Bharamagouda (Raju) Kage has raised the issue of a statehood for North Karnataka and has written to chief minister Siddaramaiah on the issue

title: Woman doctor arrested in J&K terror module case linked to Delhi car blast
content: Shaheen Saeed is the eighth accused arrested in the ‚Äúterror module‚Äù linked Jaish-e-Mohammad and Ansar Ghazwat-ul-Hind, and according to a government source, her car was used to ferry explosives. The Delhi blast occurred hours after the discovery of 2,900 kg explosive substances and weapons in Faridabad.

title: A.P. CM reaffirms commitment to Minority welfare
content: Assures free education to Minority girls up to Intermediate, construction of Haj buildings in Kadapa and Vijayawada, one lakh financial assistance to Haj pilgrims

title: Hyderabad to host Northeast-Telugu film screenings on November 21, 22
content: The event has been planned to showcase cinematic diversity and foster cultural exchange between the Northeastern States and Telangana

title: Women outnumber men in turnout despite fewer registrations than men after SIR cuts in Bihar
content: Despite four million fewer registrations, four lakh more women turned out to vote in Bihar‚Äôs Assembly elections

title: Nine exit polls project decisive majority for NDA in Bihar
content: Matrize has given 147-167 seats to NDA, 70-90 to Mahagatbandhan (MGB), 0-2 to Jan Suraaj Party (JSP) and 2-8 seats to others, while People‚Äôs Insight has predicted 133-148 seats for NDA, 87-102 to MGB, 0-2 to JSP, and 3-6 seats to others

title: In highest turnout since 1951, Bihar registers 67% polling
content: Poll panel says 62.8% men and 71.6% women voted in the two-phase election; BJP says it will ‚Äúbreak the record of the 2010 election results‚Äù; Opposition says there is a wave in their favour, asks party workers to remain vigilant against ‚Äòvote thieves‚Äô

title: Supreme Court raps Uttarakhand High Court for staying prosecution of former Director of Corbett Tiger Reserve over illegal tree-felling
content: Earlier, the Bench had directed the Indian Forest Service officer to appear before it on November 11 to explain why contempt proceedings should not be initiated against him for moving the High Court despite being aware that the matter was pending before the Supreme Court

title: Don‚Äôt use COP30 to change ‚Äòarchitecture‚Äô of Paris deal: India
content: The architecture refers to the ‚Äòcommon but differentiated responsibilities‚Äô, which means that countries must do their bit to curb fossil fuel emissions without compromising on national priorities; India says the parties ‚Äúmust remain committed to and guided by equity‚Äù

title: Trinamool demands Home Minister resign for ‚Äòfailures on an industrial scale‚Äô
content: The West Bengal ruling party demanded the resignation of Union Home Minister Amit Shah over the Delhi blast and sought an explanation from the Prime Minister for visiting Bhutan just a day after the blast

title: States ruled by non-BJP parties insist on wider consultation on draft labour policy and codes
content: Labour Minister Mansukh Mandaviya launches Labour Chowk app to connect construction workers with employers

title: DDRC accelerates Uppada coastal wall construction and ghats development in Kakinada
content: 11 ghats will be developed along the river Godavari for Godavari Pushkarams-2027 in Kakinada district.

title: AAP, Congress attack BJP over security ‚Äòlapses‚Äô; Delhi to pay ‚Çπ10 lakh to kin of blast victims
content: The AAP said that sympathy over social media has no value if the government cannot even provide ambulances for families to take the dead bodies home

title: Imported ideas like ‚Äòinter-generational equity‚Äô are anthropocentric, may not protect endangered species: Justice Narasimha
content: Justice Narasimha made these oral observations while hearing a petition on the conservation of the dying species of the Great Indian Bustard, which is being bred in captivity, and the Lesser Florican

title: Delhi Blast Live Updates: High Grade Explosives Used For Explosion, Sources Say
content: Delhi Blast Live Updates: The blast near Red Fort, in which nine people died, is being probed as a terror attack, with the Delhi Police invoking UAPA (Unlawful Activities Prevention Act) sections.

title: Hundreds Protest Against Trump Son-In-Law's Property Project In Belgrade
content: Hundreds of people staged a demonstration in Belgrade on Tuesday against the planned demolition of a former army headquarters to make way for a luxury hotel complex that US President Donald Trump's son-in-law Jared Kushner wants to build.

title: Architecture Of Paris Agreement Must Not Be Altered: India At COP30
content: India on Tuesday reaffirmed its firm commitment to multilateralism and equity in global climate action, and said that developed nations must fulfil their legal obligations on finance, technology transfer and capacity building to developing countries.

title: Former Tirupati Temple Board Chief Questioned Over Adulterated Ghee Case
content: The probe agency on Tuesday questioned the former chief of Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams (TTD) in connection with the alleged Tirumala ghee adulteration case.

title: S Jaishankar Meets UK Foreign Secretary On Sidelines Of G7 Meeting
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar met UK Foreign Secretary Yvette Cooper on the sidelines of the G7 Foreign Ministers Meet in Canada.

title: Climate Disasters Killed 80,000, Hit 1.3 Billion In India Since 1995: Report
content: India ranks ninth globally among countries most impacted by climate disasters over the past three decades, with nearly 430 extreme weather events killing more than 80,000 people, according to a new report.

title: "Trump Is Temporary": California Governor Newsom Seizes COP30 Spotlight
content: With US President Donald Trump skipping the UN's climate summit in the Amazon, California Governor Gavin Newsom grabbed the spotlight Tuesday and unleashed a barrage of attacks on the fossil fuel agenda of his political nemesis.

title: Key Zelensky Ally Accused Of $100 Million Corruption Scheme
content: Ukrainian investigators on Tuesday accused a key ally of President Volodymyr Zelensky of orchestrating a $100 million corruption scheme, as a major standoff over graft in the war-torn country escalates.

title: Sergio Gor Says He Looks Forward Serving As New US Ambassador To India
content: US Ambassador to India Sergio Gor on Tuesday said he looks forward to taking up his new assignment in New Delhi and thanked President Donald Trump for the opportunity to serve as Washington's envoy to the country.

title: Gurugram Police Arrests 2 Rohit Godara Gang Members
content: Under the ongoing 'Operation Trackdown,' Gurugram police has arrested two active members of the Rohit Godara gang, officials said on Tuesday.

title: Congress Leader Shakeel Ahmad Quits From Party After Bihar Polls Conclude
content: Soon after the completion of polling for the Bihar Assembly elections, former Union Minister Dr Shakeel Ahmad announced his resignation from the Congress, saying he waited until voting ended to ensure his decision did not affect the party's prospects

title: Delhi Court Restrains Patanjali Ads Terming Other 'Chyawanprash' As 'Dhoka'
content: The Delhi High Court has restrained Patanjali Ayurved from telecasting an advertisement which termed other 'chyawanprash' products as 'dhoka' or 'deception'.

title: Indonesian Teen Who Was Suspected In Mosque Attack, Built Bombs At Home
content: An Indonesian student suspected in last week's bomb attack on a high school mosque had assembled small-scale explosive devices at home and wanted to copy extremists he found online but had no links with any militant networks, authorities said.

title: Regrettable That Real Perpetrator Not Identified: Top Court In Nithari Case
content: The Supreme Court on Tuesday said it was a matter of "deep regret" that the identity of the actual perpetrator of the heinous Nithari killings was not established despite a prolonged investigation.

title: Bihar Elections Historic, 7.5 Crore Participated In SIR: Poll Body Chief
content: Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar on Tuesday hailed the 2025 Bihar Assembly elections as "historic", highlighting the unprecedented participation of over 7.5 crore voters in the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of the electoral rolls.

title: Those Involved In Delhi Blast Will Face Full Wrath Of Our Agencies: Amit Shah
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday instructed the security agencies to hunt down each and every culprit behind the Delhi blast that claimed 12 lives.

title: Amit Shah Tells NIA To Submit Delhi Blast Probe Report At The Earliest
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday directed the NIA to submit its investigation report at the earliest.

title: Delhi Red Fort Blast In Numbers
content: A powerful explosion near Delhi's Red Fort on Sunday evening sent shockwaves across the national capital. The blast, which triggered a massive fire and damaged multiple vehicles, led to a high alert across the city.

title: Red Fort Metro Station To Remain Shut Tomorrow After Suicide Blast Kills 9
content: The Lal Quila Metro Station will remain closed on Wednesday as a precautionary measure following the high-intensity blast near the Red Fort on Monday.

title: Masquerading As Mumbai Cop, 21-Year-Old Extorted Rs 20 lakh, Arrested
content: A 21-year-old woman from Mysuru, who allegedly extorted Rs 20.5 lakh from a man by staging a fake "digital arrest", has been taken into custody by the Alappuzha Cyber Crime Police

title: Naroditsky‚Äôs tragic death: FIDE files formal complaint against Kramnik
content: FIDE has filed a formal complaint against former World Champion Vladimir Kramnik with its Ethics & Disciplinary Commission. The complaint addresses Kramnik's repeated public accusations of cheating against deceased GM Daniel Naroditsky and GM David Navara, citing harassment and insult to dignity. The EDC will now review the evidence and testimony.

title: Left parties condemn blast, call for time-bound probe
content: Both parties appealed to the public to remain vigilant and maintain peace and harmony, cautioning against any attempts at provocation.

title: Uttar Pradesh on high alert, raid conducted in Lucknow
content: Security arrangements at important establishments, religious places, crowded places, and other sensitive points are being re-reviewed and increased

title: Residents apprehensive despite KWA‚Äôs assurance of restored water supply in Kochi
content: ‚ÄòThe concern is shared by consumers living at the tail end of the water distribution network, who often face disruptions whenever pipe bursts occur‚Äô

title: Differences in fares between budget and regular airlines blur
content: There has been no significant differences in fares between budget airlines and full-service airlines

title: Vijay‚Äôs TVK approaches ECI for poll symbol as it readies for 2026 electoral debut
content: The party‚Äôs joint general secretary C.T.R. Nirmal Kumar submits a list of preferred symbols to the ECI in New Delhi.

title: Welfare pensions could have been hiked to ‚Çπ3,000 had Centre cooperated: Govindan
content: CPI(M) State secretary says various issues, including Sabarimala, will be topics of discussion during local body polls and the LDF government has nothing to hide

title: Pawan Kalyan proposes Sanatana Dharma Parirakshana Board to safeguard Hindu traditions
content: Deputy Chief Minister says the proposed board will protect temples, promote Sanatana values, and ensure respect for Hindu faith in a secular democracy

title: Rahul‚Äôs Vote Chori campaign will help INDIA bloc in Tamil Nadu too: Selvaperunthagai
content: The Special Intensive Revision of the electoral rolls in Tamil Nadu has opened a debate among members of the public on why such an exercise is being carried out by the Election Commission, says the TNCC chief

title: INCOIS targets faster tsunami alerts using GNSS sensors, AI models
content: Scientists working to enhance early warning systems for tsunamis originating from Sumatra-Andaman subduction zone, aiming to reduce the warning time to less than five minutes

title: SCR launches QR-based ID system for outsourced staff, reviews winter safety preparedness
content: The platform ensures secure, efficient processing with features such as role-based access, OTP-based login, document uploads and a two-level verification and approval workflow before ID issuance.

title: Elevated walkway planned to connect Bengaluru airport metro station with KIA Terminal 1
content: KIA, one of India‚Äôs fastest-growing airports, is currently handling more than 37 million passengers annually and aims to reach over 60 million passengers per year within the next five years, according to officials

title: After AK-47 recovery, Kashmir hospitals order audit of doctors‚Äô lockers
content: In an official communiqu√©, the Medical Superintendent of GMC, Anantnag, directed all heads of departments ‚Äúto identify lockers and almirahs in their respective departments and wards and to label them with the names of the staff members to whom they are allotted‚Äù

title: Naidu to hand over 3 lakh houses under ‚ÄòHouse for All‚Äô scheme on November 12
content: Chief Minister to launch mass house-warming ceremony from Annamayya district; over 3 lakh PMAY houses completed across Andhra Pradesh, beneficiaries to receive keys virtually

title: Supreme Court says SIR is not the country‚Äôs first electoral roll revamp; Opposition retorts that this one is 'farcical'
content: Opposition parties say current SIR is a rushed exercise; ask why Bihar voter roll is included as a document proof for SIR 2.0; call for transparency through acknowledgement slips, machine-readable roll

title: Bengaluru City Commissioners review dog control measures
content: It is important to conduct public awareness programmes to inform citizens about the department‚Äôs initiatives0

title: Mirwaiz condemns Delhi blast; Engineer Rashid to go on hunger strike in Jail

title: Delhi explosion: Kin of terror suspects in shock and disbelief
content: Nabi, the main suspect, was a ‚Äòreligious person and passionate cricketer‚Äô, who laid emphasis on higher studies, says family member

title: Heavy rain likely to occur in isolated places in southern districts of T.N. on Wednesday
content: Light to moderate rain is likely to occur at a few places over south Tamil Nadu and at isolated places over north Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, and Karaikal.

title: KSRTC to offer complimentary Nandini snack kits on Flybus services
content: Transport Minister Ramalinga Reddy will launch the new service at Terminal 2 of Kempegowda International Airport.

title: Ministers review arrangements for Sri Sathya Sai Baba‚Äôs centenary celebrations in Puttaparthi

title: Naidu urged to allocate land in MSME Park for bulk drug units

title: Six Maoists killed in Bijapur encounter

title: Delhi blast: First lead to terror plot came from Jaish posters in J&K; attack in works for 2 yrs?
content: Bharti Jain is senior editor with The Times of India, New Delhi. She has been writing on security matters since 1996. Having covered the Union home ministry, security agencies, Election Commission and the ‚Äòprime‚Äô political beat, the Congress, for The Economic Times all these years, she moved to TOI in August 2012. Her repertoire of news stories delves into the whole gamut of issues related to terrorism and internal strife, besides probing strategic affairs in India‚Äôs neighbourhood. Read More

title: 6 drones deployed on Hyderabad bypoll duty downed with kites
content: Sribala Vadlapatla is a Senior Assistant Editor with 15 years of experience at The Times of India and 30 years overall in mainstream and web journalism. She covers Telangana's political, economic, health, technological, and socio-cultural topics, and is deeply interested in policy, governance, emerging technologies, international affairs, economy and music. Read More

title: Kashmir imam held in alleged radicalisation drive targeting doctors
content: moulvi Irfan Ahmad Wagay allegedly used his access at GMC and his prayer sessions in Srinagar‚Äôs Nowgam to reach students, identify those seen as susceptible, and push them toward radicalisation . he allegedly built and expanded a network that recruited medical professionals, raised funds, arranged logistics, and procured material for IEDs .

title: J&K detains 1,000 in sweep against terror support structure
content: more than 1,000 people rounded up so far in what officials called a 'pre-emptive strike' aimed at dismantling terrorist support networks and preventing attempts to disrupt peace . police said teams carried out surprise checks across districts to create what they described as a deterrent effect against elements allegedly seeking to unsettle public order .

title: Karnataka high court grants bail to surrendered Naxalite in Udupi cases
content: laxmi, a native of anantapur in Andhra Pradesh, surrendered to the district committee for rehabilitation of Naxalites on febr 2, 2025 . she was later produced before the sessions court, which denied bail on April 17, 2025, saying she had been absconding since 2006 and a prima facie case existed against her . the high court has granted bail to surrender her in three cases registered in the district between 2007 and 2008 .

title: India improves its rank in climate risk index from 2023
content: Vishwa Mohan is Senior Editor at The Times of India. He writes on environment, climate change, agriculture, water resources and clean energy, tracking policy issues and climate diplomacy. He has been covering Parliament since 2003 to see how politics shaped up domestic policy and India‚Äôs position at global platform. Before switching over to explore sustainable development issues, Vishwa had covered internal security and investigative agencies for more than a decade. Read More

title: From topper to key terror suspect: Curious case of Lucknow doctor
content: her arrest came after the recovery of a Russian assault rifle and live cartridges from a car registered in her name . she was picked up from Faridabad, Haryana, and later arrested by jammu and Kashmir police . UP ATS officials said she was born and raised in Lucknow .

title: 2 engineers from TN killed in hit-&-run on Delhi-Dehradun highway
content: A journalist with two decades of experience, having worked with major news organisations such as NDTV, Times Now, and others. As a Principal Correspondent covering in West Uttar Pradesh, he reports on crime, courts, politics, human-interest stories, and minority issues. His coverage includes key institutions such as Darul Uloom Deoband and Aligarh Muslim University, as well as districts including Agra, Aligarh, and Muzaffarnagar. Read More

title: Supreme Court stays order for Akola SIT with Hindu, Muslim officers
content: a three-judge bench of the supreme court stayed a two-year order directing the state to set up a special Investigation Team (SIT) to probe two crimes related to the 2023 communal riots in akola . a directive to establish the SIT based on the faith of members would violate the principles of secularism .

title: Spurned Madhya Pradesh man slits woman's throat, onlookers record videos
content: a 22-year-old woman was murdered in full public view at a junction in Baihar town of Madhya Pradesh's Balaghat district . onlookers allegedly recorded videos of the attack on their cellphones . the accused, Rohan Sarve, allegedly ambushed her near aamgaon Fata in Samanapur .

title: After property feud, woman pays hitmen Rs 6 lakh, gets alcoholic son killed
content: Sandeep Raghavan, a seasoned Indian journalist, is a Principal Digital Content Creator for The Times of India in Andhra Pradesh's Rayalaseema region. Starting in 2008 with Studio N, he moved to Deccan Chronicle in 2013 before joining TOI in 2019. He specializes in religion, politics, and crime, with notable expertise in Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams. Read More

title: On death row for 16 years, Nithari accused Koli will now walk free
content: apex court cured the mistake in a curative petition filed by Surinder Koli in the last case pending against him . he was sentenced to death by various courts in 13 murder cases and nearly executed twice . the court had dismissed his appeal as well as review plea .

title: Faridabad university emerges as ground zero of radicalised docs' module
content: i20 car exploded in Delhi on Monday evening killing nine people . police are also probing the role of mohd Istaq, a cleric at a mosque . he managed the emergency wing of the university hospital and had been teaching MBBS studen .

title: Survivor's mental state 'normal', High Court gives relief to Pocso accused
content: Ajay Sura is Senior Assistant Editor with The Times of India Chandigarh. He covers news concerning the State of Haryana, Punjab & Haryana High Court and Defence & Military Affairs. He likes to analyse political developments and decoding judicial pronouncements. His hobbies include travelling, mountaineering and trekking. Read More

title: Blast carried out in panic after associate's arrest, suspect sleuths
content: Raj Shekhar Jha is a journalist for the Times of India with over a decade of experience in reporting on national security, terrorism, crime and prisons.

title: Killed your dad, body in bag at home, woman, 40, tells married daughter
content: mangrita, 40, allegedly confessed to her 23-year-old daughter over the phone . she and her husband had been quarrelling frequently, neighbours said . police booked her under BNS Section 103(1) and launched a search for her .

title: India, US trade deal talks largely complete
content: Determine the monthly installment amount for a loan Estimate the returns on investments made through SIPs Find out maturity amount and interest earned on PPF Check maturity amount and interest earned on an FD Estimate the pension amount and corpus accumulated under NPS A Mutual Fund Calculator helps estimate the future value of investments

title: Early bets for Week 11: Bengals and Dolphins to cover, plus an MVP pick
content: the new England Patriots host the division rival New York Jets on "Thursday Night Football" the rest of the day features a plethora of marquee matchups, including the Tampa Bay Buccaneers visiting the Bills, the Seattle Seahawks and Los Angeles Rams . the Denver Broncos hosts the Kansas City Chiefs in a key AFC West clash .

title: NDA to return in Bihar with bigger majority: Exit polls
content: exit polls show NDA will win bihar and do so with a much more comfortable majority than five years ago . some even projected that it could get close to a two-thirds majority in the 243-member assembly . the polls also concurred that it will have at best a limited impact, at least in terms of winning assembly seats .

title: Delhi AQI turns 'severe' for first time this year, Grap 3 enforced in NCR
content: Priyangi Agarwal writes on environmental and climate change issues, connecting these topics to the everyday lives of people. She tracks developments across the capital‚Äôs transport hubs‚ÄîDelhi Metro, Namo Bharat Trains, and Delhi Airport‚Äîwhile also reporting on pressing social issues. Her stories blend data analysis with voices from the ground to tell human-centred narratives. Previously stationed in western Uttar Pradesh, she focused her coverage on minority issues, health, and human rights. Read More

title: Delhi car blast: Scale of explosion hints at military-grade explosives; clarity likely in few days
content: Raj Shekhar Jha is a journalist for the Times of India with over a decade of experience in reporting on national security, terrorism, crime and prisons.

title: Best morning to send a message, says Supreme Court, denies bail in UAPA case
content: siddhartha Dave appeared to acknowledge the challenge in arguing for bail for the accused a day after the attack near Red Fort . he said: 'not the best morning to argue this case after the events of yesterday' he also said he did not indulge in any overt act .

title: Passan's perfect move for 21 MLB teams that could go big this offseason
content: a deluge of moves is coming between now and the new year . there are caveats: at least one team on this list will sign multiple players . some players who could be on here are a stretch because of budgets .

title: CFP rankings release: See the second top 25 and bracket
content: the college football playoff committee will release its rankings each Tuesday through the end of the regular season . the final set of rankings will be released on Dec. 7 and those rankings will determine the final 12-team bracket . based on the CFP top 25 .

title: Women's bantamweight top 10 undergoes an overhaul
content: a pair of women's bantamweight bouts have reshuffled the ESPN divisional rankings . Norma Dumont won a split decision over Ketlen Vieira on Nov. 1 . jacqueline Cavalcanti defeated Mayra Bueno Silva unanimously .

title: Breaking down each team's City Edition uniform
content: the 2025-26 season marks the ninth campaign of the collaboration between the Nike and the NBA on the uniforms . this year's theme is all about "remixing" previous designs . the "Cream City" threads are back for the San Antonio Spurs and the "California Dream" for the Los Angeles Lakers .

title: Are Chelsea meeting expectations? 9 stats that explain their confusing season
content: Est√™vo came off the bench to help Chelsea beat Wolverhampton 3-0 . a question that should be easier to answer than it is: Are Chelsea succeeding? for most teams, it's close to black and white . sunderland have all but clinched another year in the top flight .

title: Women's Bracketology: All eyes on L.A. as Bruins, Trojans get statement wins
content: the first bracket of the 2025-26 season is here, and plenty of key matchups over the first week are already shaping the bracket . the rest of the top 16 has seen early upheaval with weekly updates each Tuesday .

title: CFP Bubble Watch: Who's in? Who's out? Who's close after the second ranking?
content: a big winner might have been the entire state of Texas . the no. 3 Aggies are still in a first-round bye position . no. 15 Miami regained its position as the committee's top ACC team .

title: Will Travis Hunter's injury change how Jaguars use him in 2026? Answering top questions
content: the Jacksonville Jaguars announced that he is having season-ending knee surgery . the no. 2 pick finished his rookie season with 28 catches for 298 yards and a touchdown . he had 15 tackles and three pass breakups on defense .

title: A drawn knife, an escape by train, a decorated military figure and Georgia Tech's first win
content: the first lieutenant, 33, arrived on horseback to the campus in the fall of 1893 . he registered as a "sub-apprentice" in a woodworking course so he could qualify . any aspirations of becoming a master craftsman, though, were secondary .

title: How to watch ESPN amid Disney-YouTube TV blackout
content: the blackout affects ABC, the ESPN networks, the Disney-branded channels, Freeform, the FX networks and the Xfinity network . the conflict affects the channel's ability to carry Disney programming . if you don't have cable access, you can get instant access to ESPN content through a variety of services including Cox, Dish, DirecTV, Fios, Fubo, Hulu + Live TV, Mediacom, Optimum, Sling, Spectrum TV and

title: IRCTC case: Lalu's plea against daily trial junked
content: Vineet Upadhyay is a Legal Reporter/Principal Correspondent at The Times of India, with career spanning over a decade now. He specializes legal journalism, simplifying court orders, judgments, complex information from Delhi Courts to make it engaging and understandable for readers. Read More
